page.title: 07Council/New Houses, Coniston
page.content: {COUNCIL HOUSES: The Garth}- a small estate, including a number of Airey Houses (pre-fabricated pre-war houses) due for renovation in late 1985. {Little Moss}- small bungalows for the elderly. This close is attractively laid out with wide grassy areas and flowering trees.{Low Furness Road}- a recent development on the site of the old railway station. {NEW HOUSING:}Under strict planning control, this has mostly consolidated the outline of the village. A great number of new houses have been built in the village since 1980. A lot of houses are let for holidaymakers, or are{second homes. The cost of buying a house here is very high; e.g. Â£48,000 for a small two-bedroomed bungalow in the centre of the village.
